args:
The sylvan spring festival—known as the Vernal
Banquet—has arrived! Luca reunites with his
childhood friends Laranoa and Sylas, before
deciding to try for the win in the festival's main
event: the egg hunt. The winner is granted
one wish, so there's everything to play for!
As warmer weather arrives, so too does the bounty\nof spring. To mark the occasion, the sylvan people\nhold a lush banquet.
This here's a cottage pie—pride'a\nmah village! Care to try one?
Come, frolic with me as I dance\nto celebrate the onset of spring!
So this is the Vernal Banquet? You told\nme the sylvan spring festival was a big\ndeal, but this is more than I imagined.
Isn't it awesome?! You almost NEVER see\nthis many sylvans in one place.
They come from all over the continent,\nand with their best local foods!\nMy tum is PUMPED. UP.
Well yeah, so's mine, but are ya really\nsure it's okay for us to crash yer festival\nlike this?
Of course! Besides, I've been meanin' to\nteach you guys more about sylvan culture.
Perhaps you could begin by explaining\nthe decorations dotting the village.\nAre they...papier-mâché animals?
Those are wishing dolls! First you make\none, then you make a wish. What would\nYOU wish for, {player_name}?
Hm... Victory and peace, I suppose.
Well shoot, now we GOTTA make one!\nThen you can make your wish, and we\ncan decorate the castle with it after.
What kind of animal should we base it on?\nI guess ＂victory＂ means you have to win a\nbattle, right? So... Hmm...
How about a dragon? They aid us in our\nfight, after all.

As much as I appreciate the making
of wishes and dolls, perhaps we can
continue this discussion after we have
taken in more of the festival?
Right. You mind showin' everyone\naround, Sarisse?

I'm gonna grab what we need for 
our dragon. A wish this big calls for a
super-sized doll, so I figure we'll need
a ton of materials.
Uh huh. What are you REALLY up to?
Hey, come on! You think I'd leave the\nprince hangin'? How about a little trust\nfor your big bro?
Ugh, whatever. I guess if the prince is\nwith you, it's fine. Later.

Annnnd she's gone. SO—all kinds of
rare herbs and stuff show up for sale
during the Banquet. There's gotta be
some that'll make for good pranks!
Huh? I thought we were collecting\nsupplies for the dragon doll...
Oh yeah, totally! But first: prank stuff.
Ooo, some exotic numbing herbs!\nAnd—whoa... I've never seen a\nmushroom like that!
It's pretty amazing to see so many\nsylvan specialties in one place.
Right?! Okay, let's check out the—
Holy cannoli, how long's it even been?\nActually, hold that thought... HAAAH!
What the—she tackled you!\nLuca, are you okay?!
Nya ha ha! Glad you can still take a hit.
Heh, you're the same as ever.\nHow'd that training of yours go?
It's over, finally. I'm goin' around greeting\nthe other village chiefs today.
I take it you two know each other?
Lemme introduce you.\n{player_name}, this here is—

Wait, {player_name}? Like, the
famous one? With the castle
and the army and the dragons?
Whoa, nice to meetcha!

I'm Laranoa. And me and Luca, well...
We were once all each other had in this
cruel, merciless world. At one point we
almost flipped a coin to see who lived...
She's messin' with you, don't worry.\nMe and her are just old friends—\nno coins or cannibalism about it.
Hah! What an earnest guy.\nI like you, {player_name}.
*ahem* Yes, well, anyway... \nLuca mentioned you were training?

Yeah, to become the next chief of
her village. She's an amazing hunter,
so the elders nominated her to take
the mantle.
I know what you're thinking; she's got\njokes AND she can hunt?!\nHeh, you ain't seen NOTHIN' yet!
By the way, how's Sarisse?\nI was thinkin' you two'd make\na great pair'a lackeys.
She's great. A little too good with a bow,\nif ya ask me, but—wait, come again?

Nope, I'm as serious as a head wound.
C'mon, what do you say, Luca? The three
of us would make a helluva team. I'll even
throw in a year's worth of apples!
That's a pretty sweet deal, but right now\nI'm kinda tied up takin' on the entire\nEmpire with {player_name}.
Ain't that a human squabble, though?\nWhy're you gettin' involved?

The Empire doesn't care who it hurts.
Humans, sylvans—we're all affected.
And I can't just let that happen, ya know?
Sarisse feels the same way.
Well dang, look who went and got serious?\nAll right, I get it; no more recruitment\ntalk.
But there are other ways... Nya ha ha...
Nope. Oh hey, know who I saw earlier?\nSylas, dude!
Huh, really? He never seemed the type\nto leave the village.
Yep. He's an aromatics researcher.\nKnows all about flowers and junk.
We're from different villages, but we\nmet him at the Banquet as kids and\nwe've kept up ever since.
C'mon, let's go find him and say hey!
Wow, what a lovely smell. Is this jasmine?\nOr maybe ylang-ylang?

It's an aromatic of my own design. There
is jasmine, yes, but I blended it with a
fragrant herb native to my home forest.
Please, help yourself to some oil.
Theeeeere he is! Still got that same\nmessy mop on his head, too!
That's RIGHT Laranoa too!\nDOUBLE TACKLE! KAAA-POOOW!
Ain't no thang! Just a light and\nbreezy greeting, right Sylas?
Hmph. I expected you would have grown\nsome since our last meeting, but I see\nnow that was foolish.
What's up, man? Don't tell me you\nwent and forgot how to have fun.
Some of us have outgrown childish\nhorseplay.
Aw, wittle baby is all gwowed up?\nI still remember that time I beat you\nin a race and you cried so hard we—
*AHEM* Pardon me, but who is\nthis human?
I'm {player_name}, a friend of\nLuca's. Nice to meet you.
And he invited you here? Ever the\nunconventional sylvan...
Inviting an outsider to an event of\nthis significance is unprecedented.\nIt presents...difficulties.
Well, now it'll be precedented, right?

The elders look less than pleased.
You should take the prince away
from here before tensions rise
beyond repair.

Sylas, the chief of the western
wood would like to—goodness,
is that a human?! Who brought
a human here?!
It seems we are too late.
You DARE intrude upon our customs?
Elder, what's so wrong with outsiders \njoining in on the Banquet?
It has been the way of things since long\nbefore even my time, boy! We cannot\nbend tradition so lightly.
Hold a moment. Unless I am mistaken,\nthis is the prince who saved the village\nof Myriage.
He came to the aid of our brethren;\nhas he not earned his place here today?
Rrgh... Fine then. We shall make\nan exception. ...Reluctantly.
If you have a moment, elder, I would like\nto discuss the research topic I brought\nup to you earlier.
Hm? As I said, your research is—no, wait.\nLet us continue this discussion elsewhere.
Until next time, Luca. Do try to keep\nout of trouble, yes?
*sigh* Man, Sylas has gotta lighten up.
Laranoa. I assume you have good reason\nto be neglecting your chiefly duties?

You must be more diligent, and think
beyond yourself. Your actions impact
not only your own future, but that of
the entire village.
Welp, gotta get back to the ol' meet\nand greet! I'll catch up with you guys later!

And you, human—know that the exception
made today is for today alone. We are
in your debt, but that does not erase
the history of our traditions.
Rrgh! Why can't we all just get along?!
Whoa, Luca—what's got you\nall worked up?
Hmm. Isn't it pretty common for the elders\nto say that kinda stuff though?
It's not exactly the norm for sylvans\nto welcome humans like you do.
But if we just keep to ourselves\nand our forests, how are we ever\nsupposed to advance?
I mean, what's the point of a festival like\nthis if we're just gonna turn away people\nwe don't know?!
It's not that I don't agree, Luca,\nbut it's not super easy to change\nthe elders' minds...
Tradition can be hard to break.

The annual egg hunt will soon commence!
Many of you would claim to be skilled
hunters of game—but what of eggs?
Steel yourselves, and chase your dreams!
I'm not just gonna chase them, I'm gonna\nmake them come true! This is my YEAR!
Holy happenstance, that's it! We'll win\nthe egg hunt, and everything'll be rosy!

It's the main event of the Vernal Banquet.
There's eggs hidden throughout the forest,
and everyone competes to see who can
find the most within the time limit.
The winner gets one request,\nand the elders grant it.
Can't believe I forgot about that. Heh.

So here's the plan: we enter the egg hunt,
win it, ask the elders to allow everyone
in the whole world to participate in sylvan
events, and we all go home happy.
I hate to say this, but...that actually\nmight work. IF we can win.
Relaaaax, you heard the elder—we just\ngotta steel ourselves! And nobody steels\nthemselves like {player_name}.
Heh, hard to argue with that.\nOkay, I'm in.
As am I. The cause is a good one.
Then it's settled.\nLet's win this thing, people!
